intro: Scolopia delphinensis, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Scolopia delphinensis is typically found in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and stream banks.
